1.q_string: Two different first order reactions have rate constants \(\mathrm{k}_{1}\) and \(\mathrm{k}_{2}\) at \(\mathrm{T}_{1}\left(\mathrm{k}_{1}>\mathrm{k}_{2}\right)\). If temperature is increased from \(\mathrm{T}_{1}\) to \(\mathrm{T}_{2}\) then new constants become \(\mathrm{k}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{k}_{4}\) respectively. Which among the following relations is correct?
A reaction is completed in \(2\) hours \(50\%\) and in \(4\) hours \(75\%\). What is the order of reaction?
The rate constant for a first order reaction is \(4.606 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\). The time required to reduce \(2.0 \mathrm{~g}\) of the reactant to \(0.2 \mathrm{~g}\) is:

q_option: A catalyst increases the activation energy between reactants and products and hence, lowers the potential energy barrier.
A catalyst provides an alternate pathway or reaction mechanism.
A catalyst alters \(\Delta \mathrm{G}\) Gibbs energy of reaction.
A catalyst changes the equilibrium constant of a reaction.
1.q_string: A catalyst is added to a reaction to increase the rate of reaction. Which of the following statements is correct?

For an elementary reaction \(2 \mathrm{~A}+\mathrm{B} \longrightarrow \mathrm{A}_{2} \mathrm{~B}\), if the volume of vessel is quickly reduced to half of its original volume, then what will happen to the rate of reaction?

The rate of reaction becomes \(2\) times for every \(10^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) rise in temperature. How much will the rate of reaction will increase, when the temperature is increased from \(30^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) to \(80^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\)?

q_option: The fraction of molecules possessing energy \(\geq \mathrm{E}_{\mathrm{T}}\) (threshold energy) increases.
1.q_string: The rate of reaction increase by the increase of temperature because:

The decomposition of \(\mathrm{Cl}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}\) at \(400 \mathrm{~K}\) in the gas phase to \(\mathrm{Cl}_{2}\) and \(\mathrm{O}_{2}\) is a first order reaction. After 55 seconds at \(400 \mathrm{~K}\), the pressure of \(\mathrm{Cl}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}\) falls from \(0.062 \mathrm{~atm}\) to \(0.044 \mathrm{~atm}\). Calculate the pressure of \(\mathrm{Cl}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}\), after \(100\) seconds of decomposition at the temperature.

The energy of activation for a reaction is \(100 \mathrm{~KJmol}^{-1}\). The presence of a catalyst lowers the energy of activation by \(75 \%\). What will be the effect on the rate of reaction at \(20^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) other things being equal?
For a \(1^{\text {st }}\) order reaction, if the concentration is doubled then the rate of reaction becomes:

Which one of the following statements are true regarding rate of a chemical reaction?

  1. Rate equation is obtained by experiment for complex reactions.
  2. For simple reactions rate expressions is obtained from stoichiometric equation.
  3. Rate constant is always equal to specific rate of reaction.
  4. Rate constant has no units.

q_option: The energy evolved when activated complex is formed.
The energy needed to form one mole of the product.
Additional amount of energy needed by the reactants to overcome the potential barrier of reaction.
1.q_string: Which one of the following refers to the activation energy of a chemical reaction?
The rate of a first order reaction is \(1.5 \times 10^{-2} \mathrm{M} \mathrm{~min}^{-1}\) at \(0.5 \mathrm{M}\) concentration of the reactant. The half-life of the reaction is:

q_option: The number of collisions among the reactant molecules increases with increasing temperature
The number of reactant molecules acquiring the activation energy increases with increasing temperature
The concentration of the reactant molecules increases with increasing temperature
1.q_string: The increase in the rate constant of a chemical reaction with increasing temperature is/(are) due to the fact(s) that:

A reaction takes place at \(300 \mathrm{~K}\). When the catalyst is added rate of reaction increases. Calculate the change in temperature \(\left(\operatorname{in}^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\right)\) which would have the same effect on the rate of reaction as that of catalyst. (Assume catalyst change the activation energy by \(20 \%\) .)
